newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian govt considers free trade zones.
newsitem.headline: Australian govt considers free trade zones.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard said on Thursday the government was considering creating free trade zones around the country to boost business and create jobs.
"There have been some discussions and there'll be a further discussion on it in a few weeks' time," he told Australian Broadcasting Corp radio.
But there were difficulties because the constitution banned taxes or other government charges that discriminated between different states and territories, Howard added.
But the government wants to consider such proposals as part of a broader review of its industry policies currently under way.
